intro: Boussingaultia brachystachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed boussingaultia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a compact appearance. Boussingaultia brachystachya is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
